alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 25 at 8:31PM CDT until July 03 at 2:20AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Scott and Clinton Counties. .Very heavy rainfall of 3 to 5 inches fell early Saturday morning upstream of De Witt in eastern Iowa. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY, JULY 03... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday, July 03. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Overbank flooding occurs. Water affects residences along the river between Wheatland and Calamus. Water affects businesses along the river near Calamus. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.5 feet...and rising quickly. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 11.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 10.3 feet. It will then do a secondary rise above flood stage again Tuesday evening, rising to 12.2 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage again next Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.
